title: MNEK: 'Being gender specific is void in songwriting' - Music
text: MNEK has revealed the reason why he doesn't use male pronouns in his music as a gay singer-songwriter.The 20-year-old British star recently released new single 'Never Forget You' with Swedish singer Zara Larsson, and explained that he keeps his writing gender neutral so he doesn't "alienate" people. "So I produced 'Home Run' for Misha B and she taught me a very good lesson that I've carried with me through all my music," MNEK told Digital Spy. "Being gender specific is void. "I like making songs where I don't have to say he or she, because then anyone can sing the song and relate to it in their own way. "Obviously if I'm going to have a love song it's going to come from a he perspective, but if anyone else does it can come from either. I enjoy having songs that anyone can feel they can relate to. "I never want to alienate. But again, with using male pronouns, it's great, it's cool, but using pronouns in general isn't always necessary."MNEK is currently working on his full-length debut album after releasing his Small Talk EP earlier this year, which included the singles 'Every Little Word', 'Wrote a Song About You' and 'The Rhythm'.The singer has also been lending his songwriting talent to a range of other artists' albums, including Madonna, Little Mix and Kylie Minogue.
